hero.headline: Save Skyline Park — Napa's Open Space Under Siege
hero.subhead: 874 acres now county-protected. 5 acres still targeted for 185 high-density units.

threat.label: THE FACTS — UPDATED NOV 2025
threat.heading:
STATE PLANS 185 UNITS
ON SKYLINE'S BEST FLAT LAND
threat.paragraph1: 5 acres along Imola Avenue — the flat area used for **Suscol Intertribal Council pow wows, SCA events, Boy Scout camping, equestrian shows, BottleRock overflow parking, and wildfire crew base camps**.
threat.paragraph2: The state designated 20 acres of the park as "surplus" — this 5-acre development is only the first slice. The Sierra Club warns that once this precedent is set, additional slices are inevitable until the park can no longer function.
threat.paragraph3: Construction could begin as early as late 2027. The developer team — PEP Housing and Collective Operations LLC — was selected by the state, not the county. Napa County opposed losing the land but the state insisted.
threat.bullet1: Added traffic on already congested Imola Avenue
threat.bullet2: Fire risk — building permanent residences in wildfire country (remember 2017)
threat.bullet3: Destroys multi-use recreation that serves thousands of Napa families each year
threat.bullet4: Revenue from the flat areas funds the entire park's operation — lose this land, risk the whole park
threat.sources: Sources: Napa Valley Register (Nov 28, 2025 & Jul 12, 2025), CA Dept. of General Services, Sierra Club Napa Group (2022).

park.label: 874 ACRES OF NAPA'S TREASURE
park.heading: This is OURS
park.card1Description: Silverado Archers maintain 22+ acres of NFAA-chartered ranges — tournaments, 3D shoots, hunter prep. Founded 1954, at Skyline since 1985.
park.card2Description: Suscol Intertribal pow wows, SCA, Boy Scouts, equestrian shows, BottleRock camping, RV sites — open space for everyone.
park.card3Description: Proven fire crew base camp. The county is exploring a new tax for wildfire prevention — while the state destroys the staging area we already have.
park.closing: Opened in 1983. Leased from the state for $100/year. County bought it for $7.26 million in December 2024 to protect it forever.

archers.imageAlt: Silverado Archers range at Skyline Wilderness Park
archers.heading: We're not going quietly
archers.body: The club maintains 22+ acres of championship-level ranges inside the park. Tournaments, 3D shoots, hunter series — all directly threatened. The state has designated 20 acres of the park as surplus. This 5-acre project is just the beginning. If we don't stop it now, the archery ranges are next.

originalEmail.label: THE EMAIL THAT STARTED THIS
originalEmail.heading: The email that inspired a Silverado Archers member to create this page
originalEmail.intro: Sent by Matt Petrini, President of Silverado Archers, to club members in February 2026. Reproduced here verbatim.
originalEmail.body:
Subject: Skyline park needs your help!

Archers,
      Maybe you can help us/ You by contacting the people in the email links below about this skyline park issue, we need all we can get to contact them. It takes 5 minutes to copy and paste these emails and the result may be we save skyline park. We have to stand up now, its only a matter of time before they will come back and take more, and eventually the club. For now they want about half of the flat area where we hold the pow wows, SCA events, boy scouts camping events, bottle rock, equestrian shows, open space for fire crews to create base camp etc. Napa is also proposing another tax increase to buy "open space" for a fire base camp, which is already there in skyline if they don't develop it into low income housing as planned.
       A few years ago the city wanted us at the park to endorse another tax increase under measure Z, this tax increase was to provide money for parks and open spaces, when we researched it, the park got like 2% or less of that money so we didn't endorse it as it seemed just another way to scam tax payers out of the money while the money doesn't go where it says it will. Because we didn't endorse it they sent in their lobbyists to hassle us about everything that we did at the park. I didn't realize their bigger play was to basically badger us until we couldn't take it anymore and I resigned, then they swung the vote and voted Dorothy glaros out of the presidency, and put people in that dont seem to be putting up any fight in this matter. Sadly I didn't realize that was so that they could then take this land that we tax payers paid for and sell it off for profit to a developer to put in even more high density low income housing, get the federal kick backs and worst of all……charge the park thousands per day to use it until they do develop it. Please please take a moment to reach out to these people and please take a moment to spread the word as best as possible to all that you know, that the park is owned by the citizens for many uses and its being sold out from under us and they are ignoring the will of the people.

action.heading: 5 MINUTES TO FIGHT BACK
action.subtext: Copy, paste, send. Spread it. Save the park.
action.emailTemplate:
Subject: Protect Skyline Wilderness Park — Stop the 185-unit development on public parkland

Dear [Media Contact / Supervisor],

I'm writing to urge coverage of — and opposition to — the plan to build 185 high-density housing units on 5 acres of Skyline Wilderness Park in Napa.

Key facts:
- The state designated 20 acres of Skyline as "surplus" under Executive Order N-06-19. This 5-acre project is the first slice.
- The developer (PEP Housing / Collective Operations LLC) was selected by the state — Napa County opposed the removal of this land from the park.
- Napa County just purchased the remaining 874 acres for $7.26M in December 2024 to preserve it as open space. The state is now carving out the most-used flat area for development.
- This land hosts wildfire crew base camps, Suscol Intertribal Council pow wows, Boy Scout camping, equestrian events, BottleRock overflow, and archery ranges.
- Revenue from the flat areas funds the entire park's trail maintenance and operations.
- The Sierra Club Napa Group has opposed this since 2022, calling the park "irreplaceable."

Skyline Park belongs to the citizens of Napa. Please help us protect it.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Napa County Resident
action.footerLine: Tell them: Public parkland is not surplus. Do not set this precedent.
